bill_title: make an appropriation for the purpose of making revolving loans to public entities for energy saving projects.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation for the purpose of making revolving loans to public entities for energy saving projects and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Within the energy conservation loan special revenue fund, there shall be created the state government energy savings subfund and the community energy savings subfund. The state government energy savings subfund shall be used for the purpose of making loans to state agencies and institutions for energy saving capital improvement projects. The community energy savings subfund shall be used for the purpose of making loans to counties, municipalities, and school districts for energy saving capital improvement projects. Section 2. Each loan made from the community energy savings subfund shall require a ten percent match from the loan recipient as a condition of the loan, and the payment of such interest established by Bureau of Administration pursuant to section 5 of this Act. Section 3. Any repayment of a loan made and any interest on the loan shall be receipted into the energy conservation loan special revenue fund. Any money in the fund is hereby continuously appropriated for the purposes of making loans as provided in this Act. Loan repayments shall be calculated based upon the savings generated by the project for the loan recipient. Section 4. The Bureau of Administration may accept and expend for the purpose of this Act, in addition to the amounts deposited in the energy conservation loan special revenue fund, any funds obtained from federal sources, gifts, contributions, or any other source if the acceptance and expenditure is approved in accordance with § 4-8B-10. Section 5. The Bureau of Administration shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 concerning the following: (1) The submission of an energy plan by a governmental entity prior to the approval of a loan. Each energy plan shall include the efforts to be made by the governmental entity to reduce or minimize energy consumption and expenditures; (2) Eligibility criteria for a loan; (3) Application procedures for a loan; (4) Criteria for determining which applicants will receive a loan; (5) The terms of repayment including interest at a rate not to exceed four percent; and (6) Follow-up reporting to the Bureau of Administration to assure compliance with project plans. Section 6. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of five million dollars ($ 5,000,000 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the state government energy savings subfund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. Section 7. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of five million dollars ($ 5,000,000 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the community energy savings subfund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. Section 8. The commissioner of the Bureau of Administration and the secretary of the Department of Tourism and State Development shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 9. The provisions of § 4-8-21 do not apply to the funds appropriated by this Act. Section 10. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.
